intro: Spirillus lonchites, commonly known as the spiral leaf fern, is a unique plant characterized by its spirally arranged fronds. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features long, slender leaves that twist around a central stem, creating a distinctive spiral pattern. Spirillus lonchites thrives in moist, shaded environments and requires consistent humidity to flourish. Its botanical structure makes it a visually striking addition to both natural and cultivated landscapes.
